summary:
Digital Currency Group’s mining subsidiary Foundry is colocating 14,000 units of MicroBT’s WhatsMiner M30S
As part of the colocation deal, U.S. mining farm Compute North will allocate 47 megawatts of capacity to power up the machines from Q1 2021
Foundry aims to retain some of the machines for its own use and sell the remaining operating miners to institutional buyers
author: Wolfie Zhao
The Block
title: DCG's Foundry will colocate 14,000 bitcoin mining machines in U.S. with focus on institutional buyers
